builder
Class DancerProgram

java.lang.Object
  builder.DancerProgram

public class DancerProgram
extends java.lang.Object

Stores and executes a Dancer Program.

Constructor Summary
DancerProgram()
          Creates an empty program.
 
Method Summary
 int append(DancerStatement statement)
          Appends a dancer statement to the end of the program.

          Adds dancer statement to the program, after the statement called statement_id.
 void delete(int statement_id)
          Deletes statement with given id.

          Returns the DancerStatement with the given statement_id.
 boolean hasSteps()
          Tells whether or not it is possible to take another step in the Program.
 void outputMethod(java.lang.String method)
          Decides whether to output to Finch or Virtual.
 void resetSteps()
          Puts the step stepper at the beginning of the program.

          Runs through the entire program.
 void step()
          Steps one more step through the program.

Constructor Detail

DancerProgram

public DancerProgram()
Creates an empty program.

Method Detail

append

public int append(DancerStatement statement)
Appends a dancer statement to the end of the program.

Parameters:
statement - The DancerStatement to append. If program is empty, it becomes the first statement in the program.
Returns:
id of appended statement

appendTo

public void appendTo(DancerStatement statement,
                     int statement_id)
              throws InvalidIDException
Adds dancer statement to the program, after the statement called statement_id.

Parameters:
statement - the DancerStatement to add.
statement_id - the id of the statement to append the new statement to.
Throws:
InvalidIDException - if the statement_id is not in the program.

delete

public void delete(int statement_id)
            throws InvalidIDException
Deletes statement with given id. Everything nested in that statement is deleted as well.

Parameters:
statement_id - integer id of the statement to delete
Throws:
InvalidIDException - if the statement_id is not in the program.

get

public DancerStatement get(int statement_id)
                    throws InvalidIDException
Returns the DancerStatement with the given statement_id.

Parameters:
statement_id - ID of statement to get
Returns:
Statement with statement_id
Throws:
InvalidIDException - if statement_id is not in program

outputMethod

public void outputMethod(java.lang.String method)
                  throws InvalidOutputModule
Decides whether to output to Finch or Virtual.

Parameters:
method - Chooses what output module to use when running commands. Either “Finch” or “Virtual” or “Both”.
Throws:
InvalidOutputModule - if method is not “Finch”, “Virtual”, or “Both”

run

public void run()
Runs through the entire program.

step

public void step()
          throws EndOfProgram
Steps one more step through the program.

Throws:
EndOfProgram - if at end of program

hasSteps

public boolean hasSteps()
Tells whether or not it is possible to take another step in the Program. IE When step() gets to the end of the program, there are no more stepss.

resetSteps

public void resetSteps()
Puts the step stepper at the beginning of the program.

This should be called every time the program is modified, and every time the GUI stops stepping.
